ragged.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the ragged blankets on the bed
ragged.translation[0].definitions[1].def: wearing clothes that are old and torn
ragged.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Crowds of ragged children played among the rocks.
ragged.translation[0].definitions[2].def: having a rough uneven edge or surface
ragged.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: The old photograph looked a little ragged at the edges.
ragged.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The crowd gave a ragged cheer.
ragged.translation[0].definitions[4].def: tired after using a lot of effort
ragged.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: He looked ragged, so I told him to go to bed.
